title: Bug 118780: Issue with alias name not appearing correctly in expression builder
EB: In the expression builder, when selecting the dataset and double-clicking on the first column name, the expected behavior is that the alias name should be used. However, the actual behavior is that the original column name is displayed below the expression builder, while the alias name appears above as 'row["column1"]' after double-clicking on the original name.
SR:
Bug 118780: Set alias for columns in dataset but in expression builder, old column names are still shown when selecting the dataset.

Description: Set an alias for columns in the dataset, but the old column names are still being displayed in the expression builder when the dataset is selected.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new datasource and a dataset.
2. Set an alias for the first column in the dataset as 'column1'.
3. Insert a data item and bind it to the dataset.
4. Open the expression builder and select the dataset.
5. Double-click on the first column name.

Expected result: The first column in the expression builder should use the alias name ('column1') instead of the original name.

Actual result: The original name of the first column is listed below the expression builder, while the alias name ('row["column1"]') appears above after double-clicking on the original name.
